key_title: Key to the species of Ixiolaena

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Involucral bracts cobwebbed-tomentose or woolly, rarely glabrescent
Involucral bracts glandular-pubescent, if cobwebbed hairs present then only in tufts below scarious apex
Leaves narrow-linear, mostly 1–1.5 mm wide; capitula mostly less than 10 mm diam.; pappus 3–5 mm long
Leaves linear, mostly 2–4 mm wide; capitula mostly more than 10 mm diam.; pap- pus 6–11 mm long
Involucral bracts with apices ovate-acuminate, slightly wider than bases; stems white-tomentose below, leaves green, c. glabrous
Involucral bracts with apices triangular-acuminate, narrower than bases; stems and leaves with similar indumentum and colour
